solution.text:
Using the formula \(S_n=\frac n2[2a+(n-1)d]\)
\(S_n=_{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*j+(l-1)*k)}}_\) and \(d=a_2-a_1=_{k}_\)
\(_{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*j+(l-1)*k)}}_=\frac n2[2*_{j}_+(n-1)*_{k}_]\)
\(_{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*j+(l-1)*k)*2}}_=n^2*_{k}_+(2*_{j}_+_{k}_)*n\)
On solving the quadratic equation we get \(n=_{l}_\)

content.text:
The sum of an AP: _{j}_,_{{j+k}}_,_{{j+(2*k)}}_,... .. is given as _{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*j+(l-1)*k)}}_
Find the no. of terms in this AP so as to get the sum as _{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*j+(l-1)*k)}}_ ?
